questions.question: He walked out of the room without looking at anybody.
questions.description: We make the simple past with the second form of the verb.

questions.question: He is crying at the top of his voice.
questions.description: We make the present continuous tense with be + ing form of the verb.

questions.question: Small men never did great deeds.
questions.description: We make the simple past with the second form of the verb.

questions.question: I will never have betrayed my country.
questions.description: We make the future perfect tense form with will have + past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: John has broken his leg.
questions.description: The present perfect tense form is made with has / have + past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: We need air and water to survive.
questions.description: We make the simple present tense with the first form of the verb.

questions.question: This has been going on for a while.
questions.description: We make the present perfect continuous tense with has/have + been + ing form of the verb.

questions.question: The child was sleeping in his room.
questions.description: We use the past continuous tense with was/were + ing form of the verb.

questions.question: They had already left.
questions.description: The past perfect tense form is made with had + past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: They had been waiting for hours.
She will arrive soon.
questions.description: We make the simple future tense forms with will / shall + first form of the verb.
